intro: Koanophyllon gracilipes, commonly known as the slenderleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are yellow and resemble those of the common dandelion. Koanophyllon gracilipes is adapted to arid conditions and has a deep root system to access water from deeper soil layers.
